answers.answer: Kind of sounds like preeclampsia. The swelling and the high blood pressure is signs of preeclampsia. Which can cause you to go into labor early. My sister was preeclamptic and gave birth to her son at 26 weeks. He died 10 days later. :/ try to not do too much. Lots of rest! Don't want to cause any stress to your body.
Any protein in your urine do you know? Also, watch for excessive swelling of legs, feet, arms, hands and face. If that occurs go to an ER and call your doctor.

They didn't say anything about my urine she told me to watch my salt intake and take it easy but that isn't easy working in fast food. I am trying the best I can and hope it isn't preeclampsia I am not trying to go into early labor at all i want to go all the way to my c - section date whenever we plan it.

If it is diet related,  really try to take very little salt  its something our body needs very lil of  same goes for sugar  eat proteins veggies carbs milk dairy nuts (unsalted) & hope for the best  worry never helps  change what u can change and let nature take care of rest

question: So I went to my doctor yesterday for my 20 week appointment. I thought everything was going to be great. When I got in there they did all the usual blood pressure, weight, urine, babies heartbeat.  When it came to the blood pressure they said it was rising up at every appointment.  I had high blood pressure last pregnancy but then my doctor told me I might have to go on bed rest at 28 weeks and that it isn't good that my blood pressure is rising and for me to gain 6 pounds in three weeks when I have lost 20 pounds and just now gained. Plus she said I have some swelling.  Has this happened to anyone else and they know what is going on? Has it just been doctor being over cautious? So scared right now I don't want nothing to happen to the baby
title: Really scared!
